# Battle of Lircay

| result            = Pelucones (Conservative) victory
*Treaty of Cuz Cuz
| combatant1        =  Pipiolos (Liberals)
| combatant2        =  Pelucones (Conservatives)
| commander1        =  Ramón FreireGuillermo Tupper Benjamín VielGiuseppe Rondizzoni
| commander2        = 22px José Joaquín Prieto José María de la CruzManuel Bulnes
| strength1         = 1,750 (1,100 infantry; 600 cavalry; 50 artilleryman with 4 cannons)
| strength2         = 2,200 (1,300 infantry; 400 mounted infantry; 500 cavalry)12 cannons
| casualties1       = 350 killed1,000 captured
| casualties2       = 89+killed
| conflict          = Battle of Lircay
}}
The Battle of Lircay was the last battle of the Chilean Civil War of 1829–1830 and ended with the Pipiolos (Liberals) being decisively defeated. Pipiolo leader Ramon Freire was exiled to Peru and the Pipiolos defeated to end the war, beginning a 30-year dominance of the Government of Chile by the Conservatives.
